articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: US wiped Raqqa off map, says Russia
articles.description: Moscow accuses the West of sending aid to the Syrian city to cover up evidence of crimes.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: WHO cancels Mugabe ambassador role
articles.description: The appointment of Zimbabwe's Robert Mugabe prompted a global outcry and wide-ranging condemnation.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Spain denies 'coup' against Catalonia
articles.description: The foreign minister tells the BBC the government is only acting in line with the constitution.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Thousands join rally for Malta journalist
articles.description: But politicians named in the investigations of murdered blogger Daphne Caruana Galizia stay away.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Spain FM: 'Many police violence pictures fake'
articles.description: Spanish Foreign Minister Alfonso Dastis was speaking to Andrew Marr about the Catalan referendum.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Police end Nuneaton bowling alley siege
articles.description: Two hostages were held by a gunman, in an incident that police say was unconnected to terrorism.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Hamilton wins to close in on title - reaction
articles.description: Live text and radio coverage of the United States Grand Prix, where Lewis Hamilton wins and Mercedes take the constructors' title.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Abe wins strong victory in Japan
articles.description: The prime minister has kept his "super-majority" and says he will deal firmly with North Korea

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Fox kept O'Reilly despite harassment suit
articles.description: Twenty-First Century Fox knew O'Reilly had settled a harassment allegation when he was rehired.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Could you make art out of your hair?
articles.description: Laetitia Ky uses coat hangers, wires and pins to make "hair sculptures" for her Instagram fans.
